ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: 8-10 hours per week
8-10 hrs/week
8 hours

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: I loved it. It gave me the opportunity to expand on my interests and allowed me to develop an original deliverable.
Strengths - provides a great experience into working at a hospital Weaknesses - this internship is less structured, it really is what you make out of it
great course
strengths: practical and real work.
The course provides an invaluable opportunity to practice skills learned in other classes such as operations, and epidemiology.
Seems like there's great variation in projects that isn't controlled for by the instructor.
Good learning experience

I think practicum during the semester is a great idea - give students some experience and idea going into the summer internship and also preparing for those interviews. The Friday meetings could be more interactive - diving students into smaller groups for discussion, etc. Also the Weinerman Room does not offer the best space... given the size of this year's practicum students. The project placement process makes people feel a little anxious and not sure if they should be reaching out on their own or not.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Richard Stahl  He's a wonderful instructor and always willing to help us out.
Instructor: Richard Stahl  Strengths - responsive to emails Weaknesses - meetings could have been shortened to be more efficient for everyone's time
Instructor: Richard Stahl  Very helpful and great professor

Instructor: Richard Stahl  Dr. Stahl offered great insights, feedback at all our meetings. He also asked questions of us to help us think more critically about our experiences. I really enjoyed working with him overall. At our 2nd mid-semester meeting, Dr. Stahl was very wordy so it ended up taking much longer than expected to get through everyone's presentations.

Instructor: Richard Stahl  Strengths - great job matching me with a practicum. Weaknesses - the Friday connects were unnecessary, especially when people were only given 5 minutes to talk during the final presentation. I've heard my peers' projects several times already.
Instructor: Richard Stahl  Great instructor, gave wonderful feedback and spoke from the healthcare perspective in an understandable way.
Instructor: Richard Stahl  Dr. Stahl did a great job matching the students up with projects and was really great at giving real feedback.
Instructor: Richard Stahl  I think Dr. Stahl did a great job in matching students with a project. The meeting seemed excessive and they took too much of our time without much value gained.
Instructor: Richard Stahl  Good - very interested in making sure we had a meaningful experience.
Instructor: Richard Stahl  Good

Instructor: Richard Stahl  Dr. Stahl is very considerate and always offers very constructive feedback when we run into challenges. Having someone on the health services leadership to serve as an instructor is very helpful.

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would recommend this course as an option to do something challenging and original.
I would recommend this course because it would give students an inside look into working at a hospital.
Definitely recommend
Great course to situate you to real life healthcare work experiences.
Definitely take this class if you want to get involved in a project.
Great course. Recommendable for people who want to get some practical experience.
It really depends on the project.
Great way to apply course knowledge.
Definitely recommend
